title: Calculator
text: Let X $$=$$ the number of days with low seismic activity. We can use the poissonpdf procedure in the calculator. Find the values that should go in this procedure.
speech: Let X  is equal to  the number of days with low seismic activity. We can use the poissonpdf procedure in the calculator. Find the values that should go in this procedure.
pacedSpeech: the number of days with low seismic activity. We can use the poissonpdf procedure in the calculator. Find the values that should go in this procedure.

title: Input
text: We need to know the mean. The mean is given by np. What is the mean? (Answer to two decimal places)
speech: We need to know the mean. The mean is given by np. What is the mean? (Answer to two decimal places)
pacedSpeech: We need to know the mean. The mean is given by np. What is the mean? (Answer to two decimal places)

title: Input
text: What is $$200\times0.0102$$? (Answer to two decimal places)
speech: What is , 200 times 0.0102, ? (Answer to two decimal places)

title: Input
text: We are finding the probability that there will be low seismic activity in ten of the next $$200$$ days. What goes into the second argument of the poissonpdf procedure?
speech: We are finding the probability that there will be low seismic activity in ten of the next  200  days. What goes into the second argument of the poissonpdf procedure?

days. What goes into the second argument of the poissonpdf procedure?
